title: [Large-Scale] Experimental Design and Machine Learning Modeling for Optimizing Fresh-Cut Leafy Vegetable Sterilization

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory microbiology and chemistry knowledge, along with foundational data analysis skills
context.additional_context: Students manipulate sterilization condition variables in a virtual lab using digital devices and experience building machine learning models. They learn to apply real experimental data to modeling, enhancing scientific problem-solving skills.

learning_goals: Identify sterilization optimization variables (such as cutting size, agitation speed) by applying Taguchi Design of Experiments (DOE) principles
Predict sterilization outcomes (microbial concentration, COD) and derive optimal conditions using machine learning models (such as GPR)
Analyze scientific data to propose solutions for real-world agricultural/food safety issues
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
